授業目的: The purpose of this course is to introduce the field of international history as well as the methodology of the discipline by using Japanese diplomacy as a case study. We will examine the period from Japan's rapid rise as a modern power from the Meiji Restoration to its utter destruction n August 1945 with particular emphasis on why Japan's leaders made the fateful decisions that would lead to the Pacific War.
到達目標: In this class, Japan's foreign policy will be thoroughly examined and critically analyzed, with focus on leadership and the decision making processes. War and diplomacy will naturally be a prominent theme of the course, and students will also be introduced to basic concepts of military history. Upon completion of this course, students will have gained much greater insight and understanding into Japan's external relations vis-a-vis the major powers of the time.
